title: Emmerdale to air special 'day-in-the-life' episode behind bars with Aaron Dingle
text:
Emmerdale to air special 'day-in-the-life' episode behind bars with Aaron Dingle The soap will air a one-off episode showing what it's like behind bars for the character and his friends and family Share Comments By Jennifer Crothers 12:49, 19 FEB 2017 TV Emmerdale are planning a special episode focusing on Aaron Dingle's time in prison (Photo: ITV) Share Comments Get soaps Emmerdale is set to air a special episode around Aaron Dingle’s prison sentence - billing it as “a day in the life of Aaron Dingle the convict”.
Aaron, played by Danny Miller, will be sentenced to 12 months behind bars for attacking Finn Barton’s ex-boyfriend Kasim Sabet in next week’s episodes.
Emmerdale producer Iain MacLeod says it’s a great opportunity to explore the challenges faced by prison life.
“We’ve got a special episode which will be a day in the life of Aaron Dingle the convict,” he explains. “But it’s also a day in the life of his family and what it’s like for them.
Will Aaron and Robert have their wedding day? (Photo: ITV) Danny Miller, who plays Aaron Dingle (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Aaron is due to be sentenced to 12 months imprisonment (Photo: ITV) “There’s a lot of news issues around prison life and the challenges people face. We thought it would be a good opportunity to explore some of that using a really well-liked group of characters.”
The episode will air “in the not too distant future” according to Iain, and will be a deep dive into Aaron’s storyline.
“I’ve yet to see it but the scripts were really fantastic. I say it’s about a day in the life of Aaron, but it’s as much as a day in the life of that family, what’s it like for somebody who’s loved their husband to prison, what’s it like for Liv losing her older brother/father figure to prison.”
A special episode will focus on Aaron's life in jail (Photo: ITV) Read More Danny Miller leaving Emmerdale? Aaron Dingle is going to prison for a VERY long time With Aaron behind bars, what does this mean for his relationship with Robert Sugden (played by Ryan Hawley)?
Poor Robert has been pulling out all the stops to give Aaron his perfect surprise wedding at The Woolpack, surrounded by all their family and friends.
But sadly, the big day is going to be ruined when the police turn up to arrest Aaron.
